title: Ticket #3642: automate parallel universe configuration in the condor rpm
description: Parallel universe requires some basic configuration after installing HTCondor. In the RPM, if possible, see if this configuration can be done so parallel universe can be ready to use out-of-box.
remarks:
2013-May-22 10:53:13 by tstclair:
You could subpackage this with a extra config file which gets dropped in a config.d location.

2013-Jun-11 15:51:57 by edquist:
Yeah, that seems pretty reasonable. I have made a sub-package called "parallel-setup" that includes a "20dedicated_scheduler_condor.config" under the config.d folder. (Perhaps there are better names for either the sub-package or the config file, I'm open to suggestions.)

The new config file is taken from the example condor_config.local.dedicated.scheduler, with the dedicated scheduler set to $(FULL_HOSTNAME) and the scheduling policy for "Always run jobs, but prefer dedicated ones" uncommented.

It seems like setting up the node as a dedicated scheduler is the only real hurdle to running parallel universe jobs after installing... but it would need to be edited as more machines are added to the pool. I am open to comments if there is a better approach.

2013-Jun-12 09:59:31 by edquist:
Initial test case works now to run a parallel universe job for a personal condor installation without additional configuration, which at least covers what was requested for this ticket.
